title: BuildingBlocks
text:
Install latest from the GitHub repository:
$ pip install git+https://github.com/teja00/BuildingBlocks.git
or from conda
$ conda install -c teja00 BuildingBlocks
or from pypi
$ pip install BuildingBlocks

title: BuildingBlocks
Mean by Row or Column
text:
source

calculate_matrix_mean

 calculate_matrix_mean (matrix:list, mode:str)





Type
Details




matrix
list
Matrix of size m, n


mode
str
representing column or row


Returns
list
result of size m, 1 or n, 1





Exported source
def calculate_matrix_mean(  matrix: list[list[Union[int, float]]], # Matrix of size m, n
                            mode: str # representing column or row
                          ) -> list[Union[int, float]]: # result of size m, 1 or n, 1
    matrix = np.array(matrix)
    
    if mode == "row":
        means = [np.mean(row) for row in matrix]
    else:  # assume column mode
        means = [np.mean(matrix[:, i]) for i in range(matrix.shape[1])]
    
    return means

title: Transpose of a Matrix
text:
source

transpose_matrix

 transpose_matrix (a:List[List[Union[int,float]]])










Type
Details




a
typing.List[typing.List[typing.Union[int, float]]]
matrix a of size (n, m)


Returns
typing.List[typing.List[typing.Union[int, float]]]
matrix of size (m, n)





Exported source
def transpose_matrix(a: List[List[Union[int, float]]] # matrix a of size (n, m)
                     ) -> List[List[Union[int, float]]]: # matrix of size (m, n) 
    n, m = len(a[0]), len(a)  # n = number of columns, m = number of rows
    return [[a[i][j] for i in range(m)] for j in range(n)]

title: Reshape of a Matrix
text:
the line of code would flatten the matrix of size m by n => which would have a size m*n
flat = np.array(a).flatten()
The below line of code is a list comprehension, and we are picking blocks of cols  let’s say cols = 10 i.e from  [0, 10]  [10, 20] 
reshaped_matrix = [
        flat[i * new_shape[1] : (i + 1) * new_shape[1]].tolist()
        for i in range(new_shape[0])
    ]

source



 reshape_matrix (a:List[List[Union[int,float]]], new_shape:tuple)










Type
Details




a
typing.List[typing.List[typing.Union[int, float]]]
matrix a of size (m, n) of int or float


new_shape
tuple
new shape tuple to reshape into (a, b)


Returns
list
output matrix of shape (a, b)





Exported source
def reshape_matrix( a: List[List[Union[int, float]]], # matrix a of size (m, n) of int or float
                    new_shape: tuple[int, int] # new shape tuple to reshape into (a, b)
                    ) -> list[list[Union[int,float]]]: # output matrix of shape (a, b)
    flat = np.array(a).flatten()

    # Validate the reshape is possible
    if len(flat) != new_shape[0] * new_shape[1]:
        return []

    # Manually reshape using slicing
    reshaped_matrix = [
        flat[i * new_shape[1] : (i + 1) * new_shape[1]].tolist()
        for i in range(new_shape[0])
    ]

    return reshaped_matrix

title: Reshape of a Matrix
text:
the line of code would flatten the matrix of size m by n => which would have a size m*n
flat = np.array(a).flatten()
The below line of code is a list comprehension, and we are picking blocks of cols  let’s say cols = 10 i.e from  [0, 10]  [10, 20] 
reshaped_matrix = [
        flat[i * new_shape[1] : (i + 1) * new_shape[1]].tolist()
        for i in range(new_shape[0])

source



 reshape_matrix (a:List[List[Union[int,float]]], new_shape:tuple)










Type
Details




a
typing.List[typing.List[typing.Union[int, float]]]
matrix a of size (m, n) of int or float


new_shape
tuple
new shape tuple to reshape into (a, b)


Returns
list
output matrix of shape (a, b)





Exported source
def reshape_matrix( a: List[List[Union[int, float]]], # matrix a of size (m, n) of int or float
                    new_shape: tuple[int, int] # new shape tuple to reshape into (a, b)
                    ) -> list[list[Union[int,float]]]: # output matrix of shape (a, b)
    flat = np.array(a).flatten()

    # Validate the reshape is possible
    if len(flat) != new_shape[0] * new_shape[1]:
        return []

    # Manually reshape using slicing
    reshaped_matrix = [
        flat[i * new_shape[1] : (i + 1) * new_shape[1]].tolist()
        for i in range(new_shape[0])
    ]

    return reshaped_matrix

title: Matrix Vector Dot Product
text:
source

matrix_dot_vector

 matrix_dot_vector (a:List[List[Union[int,float]]],
                    b:List[Union[int,float]])










Type
Details




a
typing.List[typing.List[typing.Union[int, float]]]
Matrix ’ a’ of size m x n


b
typing.List[typing.Union[int, float]]
Vector ’ b’ of size n x 1


Returns
typing.List[typing.Union[int, float]]
Resulting vector of size m x 1:





Exported source
def matrix_dot_vector(a: List[List[Union[int, float]]] # Matrix ' a' of size m x n
                      , b: List[Union[int, float]] # Vector ' b' of size n x 1
                      ) -> List[Union[int, float]]: # Resulting vector of size m x 1:
    if not all(len(row) == len(b) for row in a):
        return -1
    result = []
    for row in a:
        dot = sum(x * y for x, y in zip(row, b))
        result.append(dot)
    return result

title: Matrix Scalar Multiply
text:
source



 matrix_scalar_multiply (matrix:list, scalar:Union[int,float])





Type
Details




matrix
list
Matrix of size m,n


scalar
typing.Union[int, float]
scalar int or float


Returns
list
Matrix of size m, n





Exported source
def matrix_scalar_multiply( matrix: list[list[Union[int,float]]], # Matrix of size m,n
                            scalar: Union[int,float] # scalar int or float
                           ) -> list[list[Union[int,float]]]: # Matrix of size m, n
    matrix = np.array(matrix)
    result = [(row * scalar).tolist() for row in matrix]
    return result

title: Matrix Scalar Multiply
text:
Matrix Scalar multiplication using numpy

source

matrix_scalar_multiply_numpy

 matrix_scalar_multiply_numpy (matrix:list, scalar:Union[int,float])





Type
Details




matrix
list
Matrix of size m,n


scalar
typing.Union[int, float]
scalar int or float


Returns
list
Matrix of size m, n





Exported source
def matrix_scalar_multiply_numpy( matrix: list[list[Union[int,float]]], # Matrix of size m,n
                            scalar: Union[int,float] # scalar int or float
                           ) -> list[list[Union[int,float]]]: # Matrix of size m, n
    result = np.multiply(matrix, scalar)
    return result

title: Matrix Scalar Multiply
text:

source

Type
Details




matrix
list

typing.Union[int, float]

Returns
list

Exported source
def matrix_scalar_multiply_torch( matrix: list[list[Union[int,float]]], # Matrix of size m,n
                            scalar: Union[int,float] # scalar int or float
                           ) -> list[list[Union[int,float]]]: # Matrix of size m, n
    result = torch.mul(matrix, scalar)
    return result
